intro: Gaudinopsis, commonly known as the slender ceropegia, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Apocynaceae. These plants are native to southern Africa and are characterized by their succulent leaves and showy, tubular flowers. Gaudinopsis species typically grow as shrubs or subshrubs, often with a sprawling or prostrate growth habit. They are adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, storing water in their thick foliage. The flowers are often pollinated by specific insects, contributing to their ecological significance in their native habitats.
